intro: Lepidaploa paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Lepidaploa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found growing in moist, shaded undergrowth. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
